Key Match Events: Ismaël Koné scored an incredible goal to tie the match for Canada
Jonathan David scored the second goal for Canada to take the lead
Luis Suárez scored an equalizer for Uruguay in stoppage time
Canada fell short to Uruguay in penalty kicks
Pre-Game Insights: Jesse Marsch started a rotated side, making six changes from the semifinal defeat to Argentina
Canada battled back after Uruguay took an early lead
Post-Match Reflections: Jesse Marsch praised the team's resilience and effort
Ismaël Koné was the best player on the pitch, according to CanPL.ca
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was a Copa América third place game
Uruguay celebrated their dramatic come-from-behind victory
Canada finished fourth at Copa América
Others: The 15-time Copa América champions Uruguay celebrated their win
Luis Suárez may have played his final match for La Celeste
